bibl.title: Textiles for the Interiors. Some Remarks on Curtains in the Written Sources.
bibl.note: Focuses on arabic written sources from the Early and High Islamic periods (8th to 12th centuries). - 1. The curtain. - 2. Egyptian curtains. - 3. Bahnasā curtains. - 4. Dabīqī curtains.

bibl.title: assisted by Susanne Martinssen-von Falck, Clothing the House. Furnishing Textiles of the 1st Millennium AD from Egypt and Neighbouring Countries. Proceedings of the 5th Conference of the Research Group 'Textiles from the Nile Valley', Antwerp, 6-7 October 2007.

bibl.seg: Helmecke Gisela, Textiles for the Interiors. Some Remarks on Curtains in the Written Sources.

Antoine De Moor and Cäcilia Fluck (Edd.), assisted by Susanne Martinssen-von Falck, Clothing the House. Furnishing Textiles of the 1st Millennium AD from Egypt and Neighbouring Countries. Proceedings of the 5th Conference of the Research Group 'Textiles from the Nile Valley', Antwerp, 6-7 October 2007 (Tielt, 2009) pp. 48-53.
Focuses on arabic written sources from the Early and High Islamic periods (8th to 12th centuries). - 1. The curtain. - 2. Egyptian curtains. - 3. Bahnasā curtains. - 4. Dabīqī curtains.
